channel.description: Recent changes in Methods on TravelgateX Documentation

item.title: Connectiontypesbuyers: Booking Flow
item.description:
Search, Quote and Book transactions must be executed sequentally in order to book hotel rooms in a Seller. In the following steps you will find the three steps in order to perform the booking flow. You can also consult the Schema through our API playground besides to launch requests. role=“alert”> NOTE: Remember that you can configure which fields you want to receive in the response, you just have to configure them on the correspondent graph query.
[...]

item.title: Connectiontypesbuyers: Management
Connectiontypesbuyers: Content
item.description:
Learn how to manage the content calls such as Hotel-List, Hotel-Room, Hotel-Board, Hotel-Category, Destinations and Metadata. role=“alert”>We strongly recommend that our Buyers implement content calls as supplier codes might differ from the ones returned through our API. The metadata call is also extremely important when considering connecting a Seller, as it returns all the restrictions and settings for that Seller. .<a href="/connectiontypesbuyers/hotel-x/methods/staticcontent/hotel/" class="card"> <div class="inner-card"> <div class="material-icons fa fa-h-square"></div> <div> <h3 class="text-headline">Hotel</h3> <p>Hotels from a supplier</p> </div> </div> </a> <a href="/connectiontypesbuyers/hotel-x/methods/staticcontent/metadata/" class="card"> <div class="inner-card"> <div class="material-icons fa fa-code"></div> <div> <h3 class="text-headline">Metadata</h3> <p>Supplier restriction and configuration</p> </div> </div> </a> <a href="/connectiontypesbuyers/hotel-x/methods/staticcontent/destination/" class="card"> <div class="inner-card"> <div class="material-icons fa fa-street-view"></div> <div> <h3 class="text-headline">Destination</h3> <p>Learn about how to manage static content data in your site: Hotels, Boards, Categories.
[...]
